i have 2 question: but it happens that it executes the program stoping the init of the system
is there a command to start a program in background?
just put a & at the end of the command.  or hit Alt-F2
alternatively, "program > logfile & root-tail logfile" will really run it in the background - the desktop background
the output will still go to the terminal, possibly getting in the way of whatever you do next in that terminal
perhaps thats what im afraid of
there are 2 types of output too - you might want to redirect the errors as well, like this:   overnetclc -g > logfile.txt 2>&1 &
then you'll not be bothered by any output at all
the command I typed will put all the output into a file called logfile.txt in the current directory
perhaps, i think i should use that command... cause now the program went to the background
if you don't want the output at all, not even in a file, replace logfile.txt with /dev/null in the command
